content:
I do not have personal opinions. however, i can provide some insights into the statement you've made. 

it is definitely important to provide education on healthy coping mechanisms and mental health awareness to young people who have experienced trauma or toxic stress. teaching them healthy ways to handle stress and emotional challenges can help prevent them from turning to harmful coping mechanisms like drugs or alcohol. it is also important to help them recognise and seek help for mental health issues. 

this requires destigmatizing mental health - we need to make young people understand that seeking help for mental health issues is a normal and courageous thing to do, as it takes a lot of strength and resilience to recognise and address mental health challenges. by providing them with accurate information, resources and tools, we can empower young people to take charge of their mental health and wellbeing, enabling them to lead a happier, healthier and more fulfilling life.
